text:
My mother has very little, and my sister had a good education but ended up working hard as a governess. All their hopes were on me. I was a student, but I couldn’t stay at the university and had to leave for a while. Even if I had stuck it out, in ten or twelve years I might, with some luck, be a teacher or a clerk making a thousand rubles. By then, my mother would be worn out from worry, and I wouldn’t be able to take care of her. My sister could end up worse off!

It’s hard to ignore everything in life, to forget your mother and accept the insults aimed at your sister. Why should anyone do that? After burying my past, why should I take on more responsibilities like a wife and kids, only to leave them with nothing? So, I decided to take the old woman’s money to support myself while I studied at the university and after I graduated. I wanted to build a new life for myself. 

Well, I know I did wrong by killing the old woman. That’s it. 

He finished speaking, feeling tired, and lowered his head. 

“Oh, that’s not it, that’s not it,” Sonia said, upset. “How could anyone think that? No, that’s not right.” 

“You see it’s not right. But I’ve been honest,” he replied.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist reflects on his struggles and justifies his decision to murder a pawnbroker to secure a better future for himself and his family.
